mocharts.plot.container.Figure#

class mocharts.plot.container.Figure(chart_id: str = None, link_id: str = None, title: Title = None, grid: Grid = None, legend: Legend = None, yAxis: list = None, xAxis: list = None, parallelAxis: list = None, series: list = None, visualmap: PiecewiseVisualMap | ContinuousVisualMap = None, toolbox: Toolbox = None, tooltip: Tooltip = None, brush: Brush = None, dataZoom: list = None, event: Event = None, graphic: list = None, radar: dict = None, animation: Animation = None, figsize: tuple = (8, 6), color: list = ['#1f77b4', '#aec7e8', '#ff7f0e', '#ffbb78', '#2ca02c', '#98df8a', '#d62728', '#ff9896', '#9467bd', '#c5b0d5', '#8c564b', '#c49c94', '#e377c2', '#f7b6d2', '#7f7f7f', '#c7c7c7', '#bcbd22', '#dbdb8d', '#17becf', '#9edae5'], silent: bool = False, meta_info: dict = {}, auto_size: bool = True, style: dict = {'overflow': 'auto'})#

Bases: object

Figure object

Parameters:

  • chart_id (str, Optional) – Chart ID, by default None

  • link_id (str, Optional) – ID to link other chart, by default None

  • title (Title, Optional) – Title of chart, by default None

  • grid (Grid, Optional) – Grid of chart, by default None

  • legend (Legend, Optional) – Legend of chart, by default None

  • yAxis (list, Optional) – List of yaxis, by default None

  • xAxis (list, Optional) – List of xaxis, by default None

  • parallelAxis (list. Optional) – ParallelAxis of chart, only works for parallel plot, by default None

  • series (list, Optional) – List of series, by default None

  • visualmap (PiecewiseVisualMap, ContinuousVisualMap, Optional) – Visualmap of chart, by default None

  • toolbox (Toolbox, Optional) – Toolbox of chart, by default None

  • tooltip (Tooltip, Optional) – Tooltip of chart, by default None

  • brush (Brush, Optional) – Brush of chart, by default None

  • dataZoom (list, Optional) – List of Datazoom object, by default None

  • event (Event, Optional) – Event of chart, by default None

  • graphic (list, Optional) – List of graphic info, by default None

  • radar (dict, Optional) – Dict of radar info, by default None

  • animation (Animation, Optional) – Animation of chart, by default None

  • figsize (tuple, Optional) – Figure size of chart, by default (8, 6)

  • color (list, Optional) – Color palette of chart, by default DEFAULT_QUALITATIVE_PALETTE

  • silent (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the figure, by default False

  • meta_info (dict, Optional) – Meta info, by default {}

  • auto_size (bool, Optional) – Whether to adjust the figure element size automatically, by default True

  • style (dict, Optional) – Style css of the figure, by default {‘overflow’: ‘auto’}

add(plot, serie_name: str = None, xaxis_idx: int = 0, yaxis_idx: int = 0)#

Add plot to this figure object. If xaxis_idx or yaxis_idx is beyond the range of existing axes, their values will be set to the length of the existing axes plus 1.

Parameters:

  • plot (Figure) – The Figure object to add.

  • serie_name (str, Optional) – The series name to add, by default None.

  • xaxis_idx (int, Optional) – The index of the x-axis this plot is going to share, by default 0.

  • yaxis_idx (int, Optional) – The index of the y-axis this plot is going to share, by default 0.

add_annotation(text_list: list = [], left_list: list = [], top_list: list = [], right_list: list = [], bottom_list: list = [], silent: bool = True, fontsize: int = 12)#

Add annotations on the figure

Parameters:

  • text_list (list, Optional) – The texts to display, by default [].

  • left_list (list, Optional) – Left distance for each text, by default [].

  • top_list (list, Optional) – Top distance for each text, by default [].

  • right_list (list, Optional) – Right distance for each text, by default [].

  • bottom_list (list, Optional) – Bottom distance for each text, by default [].

  • silent (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the annotation, by default True.

  • fontsize (int, Optional) – Font size, by default 14.

add_hline(y: float | int, series_ind: int = None, color: str = None, line_type: str = None, show_label: bool = False, silent: bool = True)#

Add one horizontal line to plot

Parameters:

  • y (float, int) – The y value of this line.

  • series_ind (int, Optional) – The index of this line among series, by default None.

  • color (str, Optional) – The color of this line, by default None.

  • line_type (str, Optional) – The type of line, by default None.

  • show_label (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the label on the line, by default False.

  • silent (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the line, by default True.

add_vline(x: float | int, series_ind: int = None, color: str = None, line_type: str = None, show_label: bool = False, silent: bool = True)#

Add one vertical line to plot

Parameters:

  • x (float, int) – The x value of this line.

  • series_ind (int, Optional) – The index of this line among series, by default None.

  • color (str, Optional) – The color of this line, by default None.

  • line_type (str, Optional) – The type of line, by default None.

  • show_label (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the label on the line, by default False.

  • silent (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the line, by default True.

render()#

Get dictionary of options for this figure

save(options: dict = None, file_name: str = 'mocharts', format: str = 'png')#

Save the plot to png or html

Parameters:

  • options (dict, Optional) – The plot options to save, by default None.

  • file_name (str, Optional) – The file name to save, by default ‘mocharts’.

  • format (str, Optional) – The format to save, by default ‘png’.

set_animation(allow_animation: bool = True)#

Set animation

Parameters:

allow_animation (bool, Optional) – Whether to allow animation, by default True

set_brush(toolbox: list = None, brushType: str = None, brushMode: str = None, brushStyle: dict = None, removeOnClick: bool = None, inBrush: dict = None, outOfBrush: dict = None)#

Brush settings

Parameters:

  • toolbox (list, Optional) – Use the buttons in the toolbox, by default [‘rect’, ‘polygon’, ‘keep’, ‘clear’].

  • brushType (str, Optional) –

    Type of brush, by default None. Options:

    • ’rect’: for selection-box in rectangle shape.

    • ’polygon’: for selection-box in polygon shape.

    • ’lineX’: for horizontal selection-box.

    • ’lineY’: for vertical selection-box.

  • brushMode (str, Optional) – Brush mode, can be ‘single’ or ‘multiple’, by default None.

  • brushStyle (dict, Optional) – Brush style, by default None.

  • removeOnClick (bool, Optional) – Whether clearing all select-boxes on click is enabled when brushMode is ‘single’, by default None.

  • inBrush (dict, Optional) – Defines visual effects of items in selection, by default None.

  • outOfBrush (dict, Optional) – Defines visual effects of items out of selection, by default None.

set_datazoom(show: bool = True, horizontal_inside: bool = True, vertical_inside: bool = False, horizontal_slider: bool = True, vertical_slider: bool = False)#

Set datazoom config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the slider, by default True.

  • horizontal_inside (bool, Optional) – Whether to allow horizontal inside zoom, by default True.

  • vertical_inside (bool, Optional) – Whether to allow vertical inside zoom, by default True.

  • horizontal_slider (bool, Optional) – Whether to allow horizontal slider zoom, by default True.

  • vertical_slider (bool, Optional) – Whether to allow vertical slider zoom, by default False.

set_event(event_id: str = None, link_id: str = None, type_: str = None, task: str = 'singleselect', plot_type: str = None, func=None, additional_info: dict = None)#

Set chart event

Parameters:

  • event_id (str, Optional) – The ID of the event to store event information, by default None. If None, the timestamp is used as the event_id.

  • link_id (str, Optional) – The div ID for output result, by default None.

  • type (str, Optional) – The event type to trigger, including “click”, “brushselected”, etc., by default None.

  • task (str, Optional) – The event task to perform, including “singleselect”, “doubleselect”, etc., by default ‘singleselect’.

  • plot_type (str, Optional) – The plot type to trigger the event, including “bar”, “scatter”, etc., by default None.

  • func (func, Optional) – The function that will be triggered, by default None.

  • additional_info (dict, Optional) – A dictionary to store additional information, by default None.

set_figsize(figsize: tuple)#

Set figsize

Parameters:

figsize (tuple) – The figure size

set_grid(show: bool = True, left: str = None, top: str = '10%', right: str = '10%', bottom: str = None, width: str = 'auto', containLabel: bool = True, height: str = 'auto', backgroundColor: str = None)#

Set grid config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the grid, by default True.

  • left (str, Optional) – The left border location, by default DEFAULT_MARGIN_WIDTH.

  • top (str, Optional) – The top border location, by default DEFAULT_MARGIN_WIDTH.

  • right (str, Optional) – The right border location, by default DEFAULT_MARGIN_WIDTH.

  • bottom (str, Optional) – The bottom border location, by default DEFAULT_MARGIN_WIDTH.

  • width (str, Optional) – The grid width, by default ‘auto’.

  • height (str, Optional) – The grid height, by default ‘auto’.

  • containLabel (bool, Optional) – Whether the grid region contains axis labels, by default True.

  • backgroundColor (str, Optional) – The grid background color, by default None.

set_legend(show: bool = True, data: list | ndarray = None, loc: str = 'outer top right', width: str = 'auto', height: str = 'auto', orient: str = 'vertical', unselected=[], top: str = None, bottom: str = None, left: str = None, right: str = None, legend_type='plain', text_width=None, tooltip_title: str = None, title: str = None)#

Set legend config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the legend, by default True.

  • data (list, Optional) – The legend content, by default None.

  • loc (str, Optional) –

    The legend location, by default ‘outer top right’. Options:

    ’outer top left’, ‘outer top right’, ‘outer bottom left’, ‘outer bottom right’, ‘outer top center’, ‘outer bottom center’, ‘outer center left’, ‘outer left’, ‘outer center right’, ‘outer right’, ‘top left’, ‘top right’, ‘bottom left’, ‘bottom right’, ‘top center’, ‘bottom center’, ‘center left’, ‘left’, ‘center right’, ‘right’, ‘center’.

  • left (str, Optional) – Distance between legend component and the left side of the container, by default None.

  • bottom (str, Optional) – Distance between legend component and the bottom side of the container, by default None.

  • right (str, Optional) – Distance between legend component and the right side of the container, by default None.

  • top (str, Optional) – Distance between legend component and the top side of the container, by default None.

  • width (str, Optional) – The legend frame width, by default ‘auto’.

  • height (str, Optional) – The legend frame height, by default ‘auto’.

  • orient (str, Optional) – The legend arrangement, by default ‘vertical’.

  • unselected (list or numpy.ndarray, Optional) – The initial unselected series names, by default [].

  • legend_type (str, Optional) – Type of legend. Options: [‘plain’, ‘scroll’], by default ‘plain’.

  • text_width (int, Optional) – The text width, by default None.

  • tooltip_title (str, Optional) – The legend title shown in the tooltip, by default None.

  • title (str, Optional) – The legend title shown above the legend, by default None.

set_radar(names: list | ndarray)#

Set radar infomation

Parameters:

names (list, numpy.ndarray) – Names of each axis.

set_title(text: str = None, show: bool = True, left: str = '50%', right: str = 'auto', top: str = 'auto', bottom: str = 'auto', fontsize: int = 15, color: str = None, textAlign: str = 'auto')#

Set title config

Parameters:

  • text (str, Optional) – Text content of the title, by default None.

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the title, by default True.

  • left (str, Optional) – Distance between title component and the left side of the container, by default ‘50%’.

  • right (str, Optional) – Distance between title component and the right side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • top (str, Optional) – Distance between title component and the top side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • bottom (str, Optional) – Distance between title component and the bottom side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • fontsize (str, Optional) – Font size of the title, by default DEFAULT_TITLE_SIZE.

  • color (str, Optional) – Font color of the title, by default None.

  • textAlign (str, Optional) – How to align the title, by default ‘auto’.

set_toolbox(show: bool = True, orient: str = 'horizontal', right: str = '1%', left: str = 'auto', bottom: str = 'auto', top: str = 'auto', tool_list: list = ['dataZoom', 'saveAsImage'], itemSize: float = 15.0, itemGap: float = 8.0, popup: bool = True)#

Set toolbox config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the toolbox, by default True.

  • orient (str, Optional) – The layout orientation of the toolbox’s icon, by default ‘horizontal’.

  • right (str, Optional) – Distance between the toolbox component and the right side of the container, by default ‘1%’.

  • left (str, Optional) – Distance between the toolbox component and the left side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • bottom (str, Optional) – Distance between the toolbox component and the bottom side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • top (str, Optional) – Distance between the toolbox component and the top side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • itemSize (float, Optional) – The size of each item in the toolbox, by default 15.

  • itemGap (float, Optional) – The gap between each two items, by default 8.

  • tool_list (list, Optional) –

    The tools included in the toolbox. Options:

    • ’saveAsImage’: Save as image.

    • ’restore’: Restore configuration item.

    • ’dataView’: Data view tool, which displays data in the current chart and updates the chart after editing.

    • ’dataZoom’: Data area zooming, which only supports rectangular coordinate systems.

    • ’magicType’: Change plot type.

    By default, [‘dataZoom’, ‘dataView’, ‘saveAsImage’].

  • popup (bool, Optional) – Whether to include a popup function in the toolbox, by default True.

set_tooltip(show: bool = True, trigger: str = None, triggerOn: str = None, type: str = None, formatter: str = None, precision: int = None, custom_tooltip: bool = None, extraCssText: str = None)#

Set tooltip config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the tooltip, by default True.

  • trigger (str, Optional) –

    Type of triggering. Options:

    • ’item’: Triggered by data item, typically used for charts that don’t have a category axis.

    • ’axis’: Triggered by axes, typically used for charts that have category axes.

    • ’none’: Trigger nothing.

    By default, ‘item’.

  • triggerOn (str, Optional) –

    Conditions to trigger the tooltip. Options:

    • ’mousemove’: Trigger when the mouse moves.

    • ’click’: Trigger when the mouse clicks.

    • ’mousemove|click’: Trigger when the mouse moves or clicks.

    • ’none’: No triggers.

    By default, ‘mousemove|click’.

  • type (str, Optional) –

    Indicator type. Options:

    • ’line’: Line indicator.

    • ’shadow’: Shadow crosshair indicator.

    • ’none’: No indicator displayed.

    • ’cross’: Crosshair indicator, which enables two-axis pointers.

    By default, ‘shadow’.

  • formatter (str, Optional) – The content formatter for the tooltip’s floating layer, which supports string templates and callback functions. The template variables are {a}, {b}, {c}, {d}, and {e}, corresponding to series name, data name, data value, and more.

  • precision (int, Optional) – The precision of the tooltip value, by default None.

  • custom_tooltip (bool, Optional) – Whether to use a custom tooltip.

  • extraCssText (str, Optional) – The CSS for the tooltip.

set_visualmap(type: str = 'continuous', color: list = ['#440154', '#481467', '#482576', '#453781', '#404688', '#39558c', '#33638d', '#2d718e', '#287d8e', '#238a8d', '#1f968b', '#20a386', '#29af7f', '#3dbc74', '#56c667', '#75d054', '#95d840', '#bade28', '#dde318', '#fde725'], map_min=None, map_max=None, map_range: list = None, splitNumber: int = 5, height: float = 140.0, width: float = 20.0, calculable: bool = False, orient: str = 'vertical', left: str = 'auto', bottom: str = 'auto', right: str = 'auto', top: str = 'auto', title: str = None, dimension: int = None, precision: int = None)#

Set color visual map

Parameters:

  • type (str, Optional) – The type of visual map, can be ‘continuous’ or ‘piecewise’, by default ‘continuous’.

  • color (list, Optional) – Color palette for visual map, by default DEFAULT_SEQUENCIAL_PALETTE.

  • map_min (int, float, Optional) – Minimum value of the visual map, by default None.

  • map_max (int, float, Optional) – Maximum value of the visual map, by default None.

  • map_range (list, Optional) – Selected range, by default None.

  • splitNumber (int, Optional) – The number of split ranges, only works when type=’piecewise’, by default 5.

  • calculable (bool, Optional) – Whether to support dragging, by default False.

  • orient (str, Optional) – The visual map display orientation, by default ‘vertical’.

  • left (str, Optional) – Distance between visual map component and the left side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • bottom (str, Optional) – Distance between visual map component and the bottom side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • right (str, Optional) – Distance between visual map component and the right side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • top (str, Optional) – Distance between visual map component and the top side of the container, by default ‘auto’.

  • height (float, Optional) – The height of the visual map bar, by default 140.

  • width (float, Optional) – The width of the visual map bar, by default 20.

  • title (str, Optional) – Title text above the visual map, by default None.

  • dimension (int, Optional) – Specify which dimension should be used to fetch data values from series.data, and then map them to the visual channel, by default None.

  • precision (int, Optional) – The decimal precision of the label, by default 0.

set_xaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = None, nameLocation: str = None, lim: list | tuple = None, boundaryGap: bool = None, axisLabel_interval: int = None, nameGap: str | int = None, axisLabel_width: int = None, splitArea_show: bool = False, axisLabel_overflow='none', axisLabel_rotate: int = None, splitNumber: int = None, splitLine_show: bool = True, axisTick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set x-axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the axis, by default True.

  • axis_type (str, Optional) – The axis type, by default None.

  • axis_name (str, Optional) – The name of the axis, by default None.

  • data (list, Optional) – The data of the axis, by default None.

  • fontsize (int, Optional) – The font size of the axis name, by default None.

  • lim (tuple, list, Optional) – The limitation range of the axis, by default None.

  • boundaryGap (bool, Optional) – The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis, by default None.

  • nameGap (int, Optional) – Gap between axis name and axis line, by default None.

  • nameLocation (str, Optional) – Location of the axis name, by default None.

  • axisLabel_rotate (int, Optional) – The rotation degree of the axis label.

  • splitNumber (int, Optional) – Number of segments on the axis.

  • axisLabel_width (int, Optional) – Width of text block, by default None.

  • axisLabel_overflow (str, Optional) – How to handle labels out of width.

  • axisLabel_interval (int, Optional) – Interval between each text label.

  • splitArea_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the split area, by default False.

  • splitLine_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the split line, by default True.

  • axisTick_align (str, Optional) – Align axis tick with label, by default ‘none’.

  • axis_list (list, Optional) – The axis list input for multiple axes.

  • ignored (bool, Optional) – Whether the axis is ignored when combining axes, by default False.

set_yaxis(show: bool = True, axis_type: str = None, axis_name: str = None, data: list | ndarray = None, fontsize: int = None, lim: list | tuple = None, boundaryGap: bool = None, inverse: bool = None, nameLocation: str = None, nameGap: str | int = None, axisLabel_width: int = None, splitArea_show: bool = False, axisLabel_overflow='none', axisLabel_interval: int = None, splitNumber: int = None, splitLine_show: bool = True, axisTick_align: str = 'none', axis_list: list = None, ignored: bool = False)#

Set y-axis config

Parameters:

  • show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the axis, by default True.

  • axis_type (str, Optional) – The axis type, by default None.

  • axis_name (str, Optional) – The name of the axis, by default None.

  • data (list, Optional) – The data of the axis, by default None.

  • fontsize (int, Optional) – The font size of the axis name, by default None.

  • lim (Union[list, tuple], Optional) – The limitation range of the axis, by default None.

  • boundaryGap (bool, Optional) – The boundary gap on both sides of a coordinate axis, by default None.

  • inverse (bool, Optional) – Whether to invert the y-axis, by default None.

  • nameLocation (str, Optional) – Location of the axis name, by default None.

  • nameGap (int, Optional) – Gap between axis name and axis line, by default None.

  • splitNumber (int, Optional) – Number of segments on the axis.

  • axisLabel_width (int, Optional) – Width of text block, by default None.

  • axisLabel_overflow (str, Optional) – How to handle labels out of width.

  • axisLabel_interval (int, Optional) – Interval between each text label.

  • splitArea_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the split area, by default False.

  • splitLine_show (bool, Optional) – Whether to show the split line, by default True.

  • axisTick_align (str, Optional) – Align axis tick with label, by default ‘none’.

  • axis_list (list, Optional) – The axis list input for multiple axes.

  • ignored (bool, Optional) – Whether the axis is ignored when combining axes, by default False.

show(options: dict = None, return_html: bool = False, silent: bool = False)#

Show the plot

Parameters:

  • options (dict, Optional) – The options to show, by default None.

  • return_html (bool, Optional) – Whether to return an HTML string, by default False.

  • silent (bool, Optional) – Whether to display plot automatically, by default False.
